name: Chef John's Spaghetti with Red Clam Sauce
author: Chef John
summary: This is one of my 'go to' recipes and it takes only about 15 minutes from start to finish. The only prep work really is mashing the garlic. The sauce is great on any pasta, but I prefer angel hair or spaghetti.
ingredients: 2 (6.5 ounce) cans chopped clams, drained with juice reserved
¼ cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
Chopped fresh basil leaves or parsley
directions: Pour olive oil into cold skillet
Add garlic, capers, anchovy paste, and red pepper flakes
Place over medium heat and cook and stir until the oil is infused with the flavors of the mixture, about 5 minutes, taking care not to brown the garlic
Add tomato sauce and rinse jar with 1/4 cup water; add water to skillet
Pour in wine and juice from clams, reserving the clams
Bring to a simmer until slightly reduced and thickened, 7 to 9 minutes
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until almost al dente, or about 1 minute less than directed on package
Return pasta to the pot off heat
Stir; cover the pot to allow it to finish cooking off heat and to allow the pasta will absorb some of the sauce, about 3 minutes
Top with chopped fresh basil and/or parsley
